meanings.definition: To make (someone) a member of the proletariat.
meanings.sent1: The factory owner proletarianized many workers by cutting their wages.
meanings.sent2: After losing his job, he was proletarianized and had to find work in the fields.
meanings.sent3: The magician's spell proletarianized the wealthy man into a humble laborer.
meanings.sent4: The economic crisis proletarianized the once affluent neighborhood, turning it into a working-class area.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's lesson on history effectively proletarianized the students' understanding of social classes.

meanings.definition: To reduce (someone) to the status of a proletarian.
meanings.sent1: The harsh conditions at the factory proletarianized the workers, stripping them of their dignity.
meanings.sent2: She felt proletarianized when she had to ask for help to pay her rent.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled prince was proletarianized when he had to do his own laundry for the first time.
meanings.sent4: The sudden loss of wealth proletarianized the once extravagant family, forcing them to live frugally.
meanings.sent5: The novel's plot twist effectively proletarianized the main character, changing their life forever.
